page.title: 10CHURCHES IN BICESTER.
page.content: RELIGION:The town has a very impressive parish church-St.Edburg's.It dates from the 15th century but the first church on this site was built in Saxon times. It is surrounded by a large church yard and the nearby vicarage was built in 1226. CATHOLICISM:The suppression of the priory in 1534 made this almost non existent in Bicester until 1869 when the parish priest of Hethe came to say mass at what is now the Handy Stores.In 1943 Bicester became a parish of it's own and in 1963 a large modern church was built opposite St Edburg's. The town also has a convent in Kings End in the building that was formerly a hotel.It is staffed by the Presentation Sisters. METHODISM:The large Methodist church in Sheep Street was opened in 1927 and it can accomodate 420 worshippers.
